article.title: Bayesian Evidences for Dark Energy models in light of current obsevational data

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 compares the Bayesian evidence (ln Z) of different dark energy models to the ΛCDM model for various combinations of cosmological data.  Which of the following statements is **incorrect** based on this figure?
choices: For all data combinations, at least one thawing scalar field model has stronger evidence than ΛCDM.
Inclusion of SNIa data significantly improves the evidence for models with evolving dark energy compared to just using BAO, TDSL, and H(z) data.
The GCG model with CPL parameterization consistently shows weaker evidence compared to ΛCDM for all data combinations.
Models allowing both phantom and non-phantom behavior generally have weaker evidence than purely non-phantom models.

multiple_choice_question.text: Table IV presents the Bayesian evidence (ln Z) for ΛCDM and a non-accelerating power law model using different combinations of low redshift data. Which data combination provides the most decisive evidence in favor of the late-time accelerating ΛCDM model?
choices: BAO + Masers + TDSL + H(z) + Growth + SNIa

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula 22 describes the Hubble parameter (H(z)) for a non-accelerating expanding universe.  What does the parameter \'n\' represent in this equation?
choices: The present value of the dark energy equation of state (w).
A constant determining the expansion history of the universe.
The number of relativistic degrees of freedom.
